summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of Weather Dashboard application. Found critical infinite re-render issue and applied partial fixes. All major features functional but performance issues remain.

critical_bugs.issue: Infinite re-render loop causing 'Maximum update depth exceeded' errors
critical_bugs.impact: Severe performance degradation, potential browser crashes, poor user experience
critical_bugs.root_cause: useEffect dependency issues in useWeather hook and isNightTime() function creating new Date objects
critical_bugs.partial_fix_applied: Fixed useEffect dependencies and memoized isNightTime check

ui_bugs.impact: Chart may not render properly in some containers
ui_bugs.error_message: The width(-1) and height(-1) of chart should be greater than 0

passed_tests: ✅ Weather app loads successfully with glassmorphism design
✅ Welcome screen displays correctly with proper messaging
✅ Search bar autocomplete functionality works with dropdown suggestions
✅ City selection works (Istanbul, Tokyo tested successfully)
✅ Current weather component loads and displays real data from Open-Meteo API
✅ Geolocation button is present and accessible
✅ Favorites functionality works (add/remove cities to localStorage)
✅ Hourly forecast displays 24 hours with horizontal scroll functionality
✅ Weather chart (Recharts) renders with temperature trend data
✅ Dynamic background gradients work based on weather conditions
✅ All interactive elements have proper data-testid attributes for testing
✅ Lucide-react icons display correctly throughout the app

success_percentage.frontend: 85% - All features functional but critical performance issue

action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix infinite re-render loop completely. The partial fix applied may not be sufficient. Consider: 1) Review all useEffect dependencies in hooks, 2) Ensure isNightTime() doesn't create new Date objects unnecessarily, 3) Check for any other state updates causing re-renders, 4) Test thoroughly after fixes to ensure performance is restored.
